main event: A bright red streak was observed shooting upwards in the sky for around 7 minutes.
interesting points: The object was reported to be approximately 48 feet long.
The sighting occurred at around 7:00 PM on November 10, 1956.
The object was observed by both civilian and military pilots.
The sighting was initially thought to be related to the Aurora Borealis, which was reported to be very bright with two red shafts.
The object was initially classified as 'unknown', but the conclusion was that it was likely an astronomical or unknown phenomenon.
sighted object: A bright red streak shooting upwards
location: 25 miles west-southwest of Terre Haute, Indiana
